alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 9:42AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Lincoln, Oklahoma, Cleveland, northwestern Pottawatomie and central McClain Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 942 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Luther to near Oklahoma City to near Moore. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Norman, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Shawnee, Del City, Tecumseh, Purcell, Choctaw, Noble, Harrah, Slaughterville, McLoud, Spencer, Jones, Nicoma Park, Lexington, Pink and Luther. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 95 and 96, and between mile markers 112 and 146. Interstate 40 between mile markers 150 and 186. Interstate 44 between mile markers 128 and 156. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
